leads.lead_text: Stipe and rachises with soft hairs or scales, or stipe glabrous
Stipe and rachis with long, fine, dark, red-brown bristles; Otway Range and southern part of Eastern Highlands
Fronds separated along a creeping rhizome; lamina 3–4-pinnate, with numerous hairs, particularly on veins; stipe dull, fawn to brown; indusium with glands; far East Gippsland only
Fronds tufted; lamina usually 2-pinnate (sometimes 3-pinnate), few hairs only on rachises and veins; stipe glossy with a pinkish tinge; indusium lacking glands; widespread
Rhizome thick and shortly creeping; stipe glabrous; pinnules with apices acuminate, mucronate or apiculate; sori c. 0.5 mm in diameter, indusium not persistent, glandular-hairy around margin
Rhizome narrow and widely creeping; stipe minutely hairy underneath; pinnules with apices obtuse or broadly rounded; sori c. 1 mm or more in diameter; indusium persistent, glandular-hairy near centre
